intro: Cinchona undata, commonly known as the white cinchona, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Cinchona undata is also valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in traditional medicine.
